intro: Grevillea aspleniifolia var. shepherdiana, commonly known as the Shepherd's Grevillea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, fern-like leaves and vibrant, red-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. This variety is part of the Proteaceae family, which includes many other well-known flowering plants.
